rev.comment: This image use does not comply with [[WP:NFCC]] #10c and MUST be removed until it does. Thank you.

Line 1: Line 1: â
[[Image:I Want a Hippopotamus for Christmas Are My Ears On Straight.jpg|thumb|250px|right|Original record sleeve.]]
  â  
'''Gayla Peevey''' (born March 8, 1943) is perhaps best known for her song, "[[I Want a Hippopotamus for Christmas]]" ([[Columbia Records|Columbia]], [[1953 in music|1953]]). A child star from [[Ponca City, Oklahoma]], she was ten years old when she recorded the [[novelty song]], which had been written by [[John Rox]] in [[1950 in music|1950]] (who incidentally was married to [[Alice Pearce]] who played the first Mrs. Kravitz on the TV Show [[Bewitched]]).
'''Gayla Peevey''' (born March 8, 1943) is perhaps best known for her song, "[[I Want a Hippopotamus for Christmas]]" ([[Columbia Records|Columbia]], [[1953 in music|1953]]). A child star from [[Ponca City, Oklahoma]], she was ten years old when she recorded the [[novelty song]], which had been written by [[John Rox]] in [[1950 in music|1950]] (who incidentally was married to [[Alice Pearce]] who played the first Mrs. Kravitz on the TV Show [[Bewitched]]).
